page.title: 10PLANT-LIFE AROUND W.BERGHOLT
page.content: MOST OF OUR AREA IS FARMLAND BUT THERE ARE SOME WILD PLANTS WHICH ESCAPE THE FARMER'S WEEDKILLERS.HERE ARE SOME WE FOUND ON LAND TO THE NORTH EAST OF COOK'S HALL IN JUNE 1985.{ {BIRDSFOOT TREFOIL:}THIS GROWS FROM ABOUT 10-30 CMS HIGH. IT IS COMMON IN MEADOWS AND FIELDS, AND FLOWERS IN JUNE-JULY. IT HAS YELLOW FLOWERS. IT HAS CLOVER-SHAPED LEAVES AND SEED PODS SHAPED LIKE A BIRD'S CLAW. {FIELD PANSY:}IS NOT ONLY CALLED THAT NAME BUT IT HAS A NICK NAME WHICH IS HEART'S EASE.THE PALE YELLOW FLOWER HAS 5 PETALS WHICH ARE RATHER BLUNT AT THE END.THEY GROW IN FARM LAND OR IN WASTE PLACES AND FLOWER APRIL-OCTOBER. {YARROW:}THE HEIGHT OF THE YARROW RANGES FROM 8-45 CMS.THE FEATHERY LEAVES ARE UP TO 15 CMS LONG.THE FLOWER HEADS ARE WHITE OR PINK.THEY ARE FULLY GROWN FROM JUNE TO AUGUST.
